column4: how can i see if i have a networkcard in my computer. the laptop has a network plug but ifconfig only shows the lo interface
it lists vga controller, audio multimedia controller, bridge, ide interface, usb controller, two card bus bridges, pci bridge und host bridge
since the laptop is elderly i thought it might not have a network card
but there is an ethernet plug...
is it disabled in bios? or by a "hotkey" ?
i checked in the bios but did not find anything... hotkeys either
maybe the card was optional... so it has the plug but not the card... or it's broken
ok, thank you for your input
put your entire output from lspci on pastebin
look in bios again see if its disabled
ok, will do that..but if i don't find anything i'd say it has not eth card. thank you for your time
if its physically present ... it should be there
